title: App
review: Dosnt cover Ireland

title: I can’t get on to app
review: Please sort the app out. All I get is the loading screen whilst trying to log on. Thanks

title: Not Good
review: Not a user friendly app. It also keeps crashing on my phone. A lot of improvements needed.

title: Not the app you want
review: Every time you want to review your points message “something went wrong” comes up. Tried to enter my bank details, no luck with that either. I think it needs a major update to make it work properly. BP “steal” some ideas from the competition... Theirs work with no issues!!!!

title: Cumbersome
review: Ridiculous that you can’t download your reward card with barcode into apple wallet like most other reward cards. This means a number of fumbles clicks before you can pull up the barcode- meanwhile the queues at the till grow in number...

title: Doesn’t work
review:
Every time I try to log in, I’m asked to verify with a code, then set secret question and then a PIN, only to be told that my email address is ‘already registered’.

I know that.  That’s why I’m trying to log in and not ‘register’ (and yes, I am tapping the correct on-screen ‘button’).

Exasperated.
developerResponse: {'id': 13811058, 'body': "Hi there, we are sorry you are having trouble logging on. If you contact our BPme Rewards Customer Service team at BPmeRewards@bp.com they'll be able to help you further. Many thanks, ^EP", 'modified': '2020-03-02T16:06:14Z'}

title: Causes too many issues
review:
There seem to be too many bugs in this system. I’ve set this up twice now and each time when trying to buy fuel £100 is pre authorised on my card. Then there is an error message and I have to just pay in store. The transaction is reversed on my card so money is lost.

Last time I used the reward card part of the app when the cashier scanned the reward card the entire till crashed and had to be rebooted! This resulted in me having to pay for my fuel twice. I now need to try and get a refund on one of the transactions.

This is a good idea, just badly implemented and poorly tested.

title: Terrible - not iOS coded
review:
Population boxes not set correctly so the app doesn’t prompt iOS for your email, name or password etc - what are BP paying the developer for!??

Clunky, non intuitive and the data isn’t accurate - sites don’t have the facilities listed-  if BP don’t know what’s on their site(s) I would be asking serious auditing questions or they’re not providing accurate data to the developer then this is serious fail.
developerResponse: {'id': 8424556, 'body': "Hi there. We're really sorry you had some issues with the app. Please contact our support team at bpmeuk@bp.com and they'll take a look into it for you. Thanks ^CF", 'modified': '2019-04-29T08:29:58Z'}

title: Paper coupons!!??
review: Why on earth have an app and then the garage hands out bits of paper with offers etc, utterly bizarre

title: A solution in search of a problem?
review: Used this for some time without issue, then all if a sudden my card gets declined twice in succession. However, it works perfectly OK at the till. Don’t know if the problem is with the app itself or with the verification process, but i’m not going to risk having my card blocked.
developerResponse: {'id': 13934517, 'body': "Hi there, we are sorry you are having trouble with your BPme Reward card. If you contact our BPme Rewards Customer Service team at BPmeRewards@bp.com they'll be able to help you further. Many thanks, ^EP", 'modified': '2020-03-09T09:14:53Z'}

title: When it works
review: Whilst most of the time this app works amazingly as it should I recently have nothing but issues every time I try and use the app to save time I end up using more time because all it says is we are having issues unlocking you pump please try again or speak to a member off staff nope staff don’t have a clue I think I’ll just save my self the hassle and go somewhere I can pay at pump I have two small children don’t have time to get them out car to pay and get them back in to leave crazy

title: Don’t waste your time
review:
So many security question (more then for setting up a bank account).

Then after going through this hell, it is not possible to link the card and getting error message

title: Can’t log a password
review:
This app is pathetic. I may change my opinion if only I could get into it. My password has to be at least 10 digits long and include numbers and uppercase letters. It keeps accepting passwords then on the next screen say they aren’t correct. Emails with links take you to the website and not the app. And of course BP aren’t in when I’m doing this!

Seriously this is a total waste of time and I haven’t had an issue like this with any other app. Time to sack the app developers and employ a school child. 
—————————————-

I eventually managed to log on to this app but then it would not recognise my BP card. I wasn’t told and it doesn’t say to wait 24 hours. So now I’m up and running but I won’t be adding my credit card details, I’ll just the app to record the points I get the few times I use a BP petrol station.
developerResponse: {'id': 14039760, 'body': "Hi there, we are sorry you are having trouble logging into our app. If you contact our BPme UK Customer Service team at BPmeUK@bp.com they'll be able to help you further. Many thanks, ^LD", 'modified': '2020-03-15T12:29:36Z'}

title: Really painful
review: It’s meant to be easy but not worth the hassle

title: Spinning wheel during download
review: That is as far as it got !

title: How not to design an app
review: The sign up process is so utterly laborious, with so many steps that I gave up several months ago, simply couldn’t be bothered with the aggro. I only recently signed up again due to the corona virus situation and the need to pay at pump. Honestly BP, look at how Esso and Shell have implemented registration in their apps and take a leaf out of their book.

title: Terrible
review:
After filling in all my details, verifying my email address via email, then verifying the password I set via a code sent to my email address, then verifying the pin that it asks you to set it took me 15 minutes to get started. That was only the start of the problem. After filling it up said there was a issue so I then went to talk to the cashier. He managed to find the transaction so the payment went through, yet the app then reminded me it hadn’t. I had to force close the app to get rid of the message and in doing so it forgot all my details. Thankfully I got a receipt from the cashier.

It’s a good idea but really poorly executed. The developers should be embarrassed.
developerResponse: {'id': 14139714, 'body': "Hi there, we're really sorry to hear you've had a bad experience with app but glad to hear your payment has gone through. If you experience further problems, please get in touch with our support team at BPmeRewards@bp.com thanks ^FH ", 'modified': '2020-03-20T10:41:55Z'}

title: Rubbish
review: Compared to others this is not fit for purpose. Asks for validation code, emails never received so you can’t use the app. Shell or Esso far superior..

title: Fails to unlock pump 75% of tries
review:
Successfully used this three times... in fifteen visits and twelve failed attempts. “Something went wrong” as an error message over and over is an exercise in uselessness.
Unless walking to the cashier on crutches is an issue, really (no, REALLY) don’t bother with this app.
developerResponse: {'id': 8209764, 'body': 'Hi, it sounds like something hasn’t happened as it should, so thanks for letting us know and giving us the chance to fix it. If you wish to speak to someone in the meantime, please get in touch at BPmeUK@bp.com or call 0800 402402. Thanks, ^CF', 'modified': '2019-04-15T07:52:41Z'}

title: Wait and see
review:
22/March - Sign up was terrible, signup button triggered by registration email didn’t work. The warning should’ve have been the link below that said click here if the button doesn’t work.

Will test mobile pay tomorrow (have favourited my local station and setup my debit card). Let’s if they’ve sorted out locating stations and charging for the right amount.

title: Tried to use today ... fail
review: Tried to use today but would not get past the confirm screen - connection time out. Had to resort to Apple Pay and limit to £30 of fuel. Have used for 2 years and found this app to be reliable only 50% of the time so it’s somewhat pointless.

If it’s still not working for you, please drop our team a line on 0800402402 or at bpmeuk@bp.com. Thanks, ^AB', 'modified': '2018-08-07T10:08:05Z'}

title: Great for quickness
review:
Haven’t had any issues really in the time I’ve been using the app.
It’s great for when you’re on the motorbike too.  Saves issues removing helmet and other gear that get cards out etc..

Only issue I’ve had is other customers trying to stop me as they think I’m stealing fuel as I drive off!!

title: Doesn’t work for almost a month
review: Internal error message

title: Doesn’t work
review:
Spent 10 minutes trying to set up account, with no joy.  Keeps asking me to change password when logging in.  I give up

I will just have to use shell or Esso instead.
developerResponse: {'id': 14440960, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear you're having trouble. Please get in touch with our app team at bpmeuk@bp.com and they'll give you a hand! Thanks ^FH ", 'modified': '2020-04-03T14:53:31Z'}

title: Straight forward, does the job
review:
Does a great job. 

Enhancement request - please integrate Apple sign on and Apple Pay!
developerResponse: {'id': 14440901, 'body': "Thanks for your feedback! We'll relay this to the teams. ^FH", 'modified': '2020-04-03T14:51:07Z'}

title: The App after initially not working well is now fantastic
review:
So I wrote a fairly long example of why this app didn’t seem to bring any benifits, but lots of frustrations in my review around a year ago.

We are now in nearly April 2020 and I am delighted to update on the latest version(s) which seem to have addressed all of the initial bugs or frustrations.

This app now works very well, and is my preferred payment method, although seeing at the Collaboration with the M&S food courts are so good, I often go into the store to buy a few items and pay for the fuel and shopping together. It’s here that the app has its second usage as it doubles up as a loyalty card and it doesn’t take long for the savings and offers to build it. 

It might have taken a few issues to get it working well, but BP you have nailed it now.

Brilliant. 

Recommend to any of your customers to get.
developerResponse: {'id': 14343516, 'body': 'We’re glad you’re enjoying the app, and it’s helping during this difficult time. Stay safe! ^DS', 'modified': '2020-03-30T19:45:09Z'}

review: The app doesn’t allow you to add the barcode to the wallet app in iPhone.

title: Payment card issue
review: Can't add payment card. Even after reinstall app. Will use Shell instead. More reliable.

title: Crashes and won’t let your bank pay
review: This app has been hit and miss for me.  It worked when I first had the app.  Then it kept telling me my bank declined payment even though I followed the text by saying yes it was me. Today during covid 19 when I really need this to so I could maintain a social distances and avoid not having to go into the shop to pay the app just kept crashing.

title: Add to wallet please
review: Could you add the BPme rewards to the  wallet. Normally I walk with just my phone and end up loosing points because your card is not electronic.
developerResponse: {'id': 14818083, 'body': 'Hi there, you can add your BPme rewards card to our BPme app. You can find more information on our website here: https://www.bpmerewards.co.uk/registration/register. Many thanks, ^EP ', 'modified': '2020-04-21T15:28:32Z'}

title: Simple, easy and no more queuing!
review:
I’d seen this advertised on forecourts for a while now but never thought about it until the recent covid issue. I thought it a win win for everyone, keep the station staff safer by not having to go in and hand over cash and me out of the queues inside. It is very easy to use, works flawlessly on my iPhone X and BPs YouTube videos showed me how it worked in practice. I was a little nervous about using it, I didn’t want to fill up and drive away without paying. It is a little alien to just drive off but I’ll get used to it.  

 For those having issues, be sure to not mess around with the location settings of your phone or it’ll never find the station you’re at. Thanks BP for a smooth app.
developerResponse: {'id': 14819498, 'body': "We are so glad to hear this! We'll pass this along to our teams. Many thanks and take care, ^EP", 'modified': '2020-04-21T16:46:26Z'}

title: Rubbish app
review:
Since the update, I now can’t log on to my account when filling up, so now can’t use the barcode on the app to collect my points. 

The app takes too long to open when it did work, so if you don’t use it to pay, as I don’t as I have a company fuel card, and forget to open the app when I get to the filling station, by the time I’ve got to the till, it still hasn’t opened to the barcode I need to swipe. 

You need to sort this out as you are going to lose customers with this rubbish app.
developerResponse: {'id': 14819401, 'body': "Hello, sorry you're having trouble with the app. Please drop our team a line at 0800402402 or at bpmeuk@bp.com and they will help you with this.Thanks and stay safe ^EP", 'modified': '2020-04-21T16:39:25Z'}

title: Excellent during covid19
review: Downloaded this app set it all up the night before.  Went to local Bp filling station and tired it out. I double checked with store manager as I felt uncomfortable just driving off after a good chat with store manager this will be my new way of paying.  Top tip set up an email and your receipt will be emailed to you.  The app sets a limit of £100 to spend at the pump before you drive off check your app to make sure payment been received.  Well done BP
developerResponse: {'id': 14819553, 'body': "Thank you for your feedback Anthony! We'll pass it onto our team. Many thanks ^EP", 'modified': '2020-04-21T16:50:27Z'}

title: No App
review:
Never!! 

Have I ever been so dissatisfied with an App! 

Bp?? Really lost for words?? 

You have put these loyalty cards out there.
There seems no reason for this?? As when you try to register?? And clearly cannot!! 
It then says to contact you???? 

Which I have just tried? 
Via email! 
I have been told this??
Sorry we will look into this!! 
Hope this is helpful to you??
No really not helpful?? 
Thanks for nothing Bp!! 
Just a lot of wasted time!!! 😡😡

title: Yet to give me pump selection
review: I use Chertsey BP station and while the app finds the correct station it will not let me select a pump and says they are unavailable. I was the only one getting fuel this afternoon. Tried this app now for at least two months and fully registered and payment card on it so I do not know what is wrong. Might start to use the Esso one again as this works. It’s just the BP is more convenient and I don’t do it for the points

title: Don’t waste your time.
review: Updated it so you can’t login anymore, just created with a slink g wheel after being forced to click register again! Even when it does work (older version) it just opens a mobile browser where you need to login to redeem anyway!

title: Not very intuitive
review:
It’s not the easiest app to use and it’s almost impossible to get your reward points
Once they fix these issues, this will be a slick app
But for now, a lot more work is needed

title: Completely useless
review: Installed this app so I could pay for fuel at my local BP station to respect social distancing and not come into contact with staff. Filled up my car, tried to use the app and it didn’t work so had to go inside and pay anyway. Absolutely useless, I’ll delete it.

title: Rubbish - great idea, poor execution
review:
Having been registered for BP rewards for a while I downloaded the app in order to pay for petrol without going into pay for it.  Total waste of time because it won’t log me in, keeps displaying message saying sorry an error has occurred. After the fifth time of trying, and reading the reviews of how this works, have deleted the app and will continue to pay in shop, to a person I can interact with, knowing exactly how much I have spent immediately.
Great idea, but as with many other great virtual ideas, cannot replace actual real people. Great idea poorly executed - must try harder!

title: Dire,truly, truly dire!
review: I have missed out on so many points it’s untrue. And I wish the service station staff would make up their minds whether they need the app before or after payment has been made if using it in store! If I Co LoI lad give I zero start I would!

title: Buggy app doesn’t work
review: Thought I’d give the app a try to avoid the covid19 queues. Entire app is buggy and clearly hasn’t been user tested whatsoever. First attempt to pay results in an error and advise to pay in shop. What garbage.

title: Terrible app- never works!
review: Had Since covid -19 to stop going inside but doesn’t work at all. Even the staff do not know how it works

title: Won’t let me add my card
review: Waste of time!

title: Can’t install
review: We’ll not install

title: Update doesn’t work
review:
The was working fine until I got the update sign saying please update to the newer version of BP app. Tried several times updating the app doesn’t seem to work. 

It’s a shame that I filled my car with ultimate diesel  fuel in order to earn more points. However, couldn’t open my BP app.

Thanks.

title: Warning!  Do not use!
review: I just put £16 of fuel in my car and paid for it with this app.  When I got home I checked my account - £100 had been debited, putting me into the red!  The £16 payment had not yet been processed.  BP’s website blames the banks and the way they operate with pre-authorisation checks.  This is buck-passing.  Other online shops do pre authorisation checks WITHOUT debiting your account £100 so why doesn’t BP?  I will now be out of pocket due to the bank imposing interest on the overdrawn account.  This is a rip off!  I will not be using either the app or BP filling stations again.

title: Good app
review:
Been using for a while, very helpful.
But annoying atm as can’t open the app as it says needs an update, takes you to AppStore where it just says open. Not update.

title: Disgusted
review: App update useless.Will collect Nectar points elsewhere

title: Not good
review: Why no face recognition for login?

title: BP App Is absolutely Hopeless
review: Every time you get to the toll to pay for petrol the app won’t load, the app needs updating, the app can’t be bothered absolutely hopeless - almost a con to save BP from crediting customers. I would leave zero stars but it won’t let me. And another thing every single nickname I try to add it won’t accept I’m on my 10th try with some of the most obscure names and numbers you could think off and it won’t let me submit.... may be it only accepts nicknames with 4 stars or more - absolutely hopeless

title: Good when it works.
review: All I get at the moment is a message to update but that process doesn’t work can’t get any further

title: That’ll teach me...
review:
to pay attention to what at least half of the other reviewers have said on here!
Downloaded the latest version of this app yesterday 
Set up account and bank details, and received a welcome message informing me that all was ready to go.
I thought I’d try it out at my local brand new, super  hi-tech BP/M&S station on the A143 just outside Diss.
Didn’t work!
The app recognised the fuel station via gps, recognised the entered pump number and the “fill tank” option only to fail at the “unlocking pump” stage
So, cancelled the attempt and fuelled/payed as normal.
The girl at the checkout said that this was pretty much standard, due apparently to “poor signal” She said that most customers have said the app is more suited to inner city use (?!&£)
This despite my phone having a strong 4G signal at that location.
So, back to Shell it is then!

Just hoping that BP support doesn’t try to “reach out” to explain what might have gone wrong!

title: Rubbish
review: Very bad app. Can never get money off my shopping or fuel despite having over £30 on my card, although thats what the main perk is supposed to be. Seems like they just want you to sign up for Thier marketing benefits! My friends a family wanted to sign up! I stopped them! Nonsense loyalty programme

title: Can’t pay at pump
review:
Same situation as noted by Verity. Brand new Service station at Diss and have tried and failed twice to pay at the pump. For me no other reason to use the App, especially when there is a queue outside the garage to pay in store.

Useless.

title: Doesn’t work
review:
Utter garbage. Downloaded today as, due to recent events and with vulnerable relatives in family, am now determined to always pay via app from inside car and then do fuelling only to minimise contact. Have recently started doing this with the Shell app which has been totally smooth and trouble free. 
Registered, saw no Apple Pay support so had to add my Revolut card as only had phone on me. Got error saying ‘your bank has declined the transaction’, which I thought was odd as had never had issues before. Nonetheless assumed it was a Revolut problem, so drove home and added not 1 but 2 other cards, each from a different bank. Came back, and both returned the same error. Between the 3 cards I tried - 3 different providers, some debit some credit, some Visa some MasterCard. So clearly an app issue. (To clarify - there WERE no declined transactions, the message is just a bug).
Uninstalled and will use Shell from now on.

title: Good but...
review: Decent app interface and speedier now for accessing pay at pump. Still missing vital (but simple) features like Apple Pay for payment and Apple Wallet for easier use of BPMe card in-store.

title: App never works
review: App never works properly for viewing how many points I have saved. Always says there’s an error and to check later. I think it has worked about 3 times over the many times I’ve tried to use it. Now it’s not even letting me sign in.

title: Andy
review:
The app works just fine and I have never had any problems with the full tank option or locating a station as some users have mentioned.
The only flaw however is that the receipt is not emailed as a PDF which makes it very difficult to submit a file to my online expenses app for work.

title: BP SORT YOUR APP
review:
always same issues login and can’t use card I’m not the only. 

Cmon marketing at BP sort this out.

title: Whoops BP got it wrong
review: Opened App it says update avail. Go to App Store and no update, just open app, so an endless loop sitting on garage forecourt alongside pump. Well done BP.

title: Doesn’t Work!
review:
“Apologies, there appear to be no pumps available right now”

Looks around and it’s an empty forecourt in the late afternoon?

I had this issue when it launched and thought that it was early days, I’ll wait for them to work out the kinks.

Tried again just now, and look same message. Must be my account as everyone else seems to give it 4-5 stars.

title: Not well thought through!!
review: This app is a joke, nobody thought about how it will be used in real life. Forcing you to install updates when you’re sat in your car with a queue of angry motorists behind you is ridiculous!!! Let me use it, I’ll update later! Also, what currently happens is the app forces me to the App Store page, App Store says there isn’t an update available and now I’m stuck in an infinite loop. At a time where we need to social distance you’re now forcing me to go in the shop. Massive fail.

title: Needs huge improvement
review:
Tried 3 times, as I think it is a great idea. Worked once. Twice couldn’t open pump. Sat there so long got out took petrol normal way. 

Get this working good it will be great!

title: Didn’t work
review:
I downloaded this this morning as I did not want to go into our BP filling station for distancing reasons. Pulled up at pump, completed payment card details, got message to start using pump, then ... nothing. Had to reopen car door two or three times to see what the app was saying, finally the man in the filling station waved at me to indicate I should go over to him. App apparently not working today, so I ended up having to go inside to pay after all. Not impressed. The man in the car behind me was remarkably tolerant in the circumstances. 

Just went back to most recent reviews and they seem to be universally negative. How can a major company like BP produce such a rubbish app?

title: Can’t set the app up
review: Terrible set up. Won’t create an account within the app. Tried going on line on a pc to add my BP card & it thinks it’s a mobile device & wants me to either give my credit card details or redownload the app. Simple answer if I can’t get the app to work is to not go to BP again!

title: I can’t be bothered anymore
review:
Having tried many times to log in It is not worth the effort anymore. I contacted BP rewards team and at their request deleted old App re-installed new version and bingo it worked. However, I decided it was time to change my password, received link and duly changed. Tried to log back in same problem as the old App had returned.
I give it one star as I like the colour.

title: Very frustrating that I can’t even register
review: Your app seems to have lots of faults. It’s so frustrating. Constantly typing in a password and getting error, then changing a password and getting “cant use the old one” WHEN THE OLD ONE NEVER WORKED ANYWAY!!!

title: Changed
review: Used to be okay but now can’t even log in just says ‘something went wrong please try again

title: If only it worked
review:
Setting this up was great, checking into a pump was fine. But I kept getting a ‘payment declined by bank’ message so got no further. Tried re-registering bank card, tried another one, same result.

Had to limp home with empty tank, get physical card, fill up and pay inside, using the buttons on the card machine. Asked cashier why app did t work but he had ‘no idea’.

So, my hopes of minimising physical contact were dashed. Having also now read horror stories of £100 being ‘reserved’ for up to 10 days, I think I’ll give up on this.

What a shame. It seemed exactly what we all need right now.

title: Dreadful app
review: Whenever I fill up I have to log back in or update the app. This time I couldn’t use the app as it needed updating. The update link opened iTunes Store not App Store. The link in the store didn’t update the app but simple took to the BPMe app ... which said it needed updating. Round and round in circles. Even manually searching in the App Store the BPMe app just opened the app rather than letting me update it. After 10 minutes of trying I gave up and searched for the a screenshot of the BP card for the station to scan - I’ve now saved this for future use instead of wasting time at the pumps and annoying everyone behind me. Since I’m buying a large tank of premium every time, the points matter. Shell’s app seems much better.

title: Still broken
review: I have never been able to add a credit card. I get a “something went wrong “ message

title: Mr
review: Hopeless keeps rejecting my password set even though it is 10 digits with numbers and upper and lower case letters.....

title: Hasn't worked since last update
review: This app is utterly useless! It worked fine until the last update but just will not work anymore. I've deleted, reinstalled several times. I've deleted previous card info but now can't re-register my fuel card even with a new activation code!!
developerResponse: {'id': 16586050, 'body': "Hi Alistair, sorry you're having trouble with the app. Please drop our team a line at 0800402402 or at bpmeuk@bp.com and they will help you with this. Many thanks, ^EP", 'modified': '2020-07-13T08:44:27Z'}

title: Can’t select pump !?
review:
Took 15 minutes today at the pump to get it to work. Then when returning to the car it said payment had failed so had to go in to pay by card. Really shoddy - just a bit of eye-candy marketing. Fossil fuel, fossil app. 

—-

At pump 16.  App says select pump only lists up to 15.  Genius.

title: The app doesn’t take Amex
review: The app would be perfect for someone like me but it doesn’t allow you to pay with Amex.. so as far as I’m concerned, it’s useless until this simple fix is added.

title: Terrible app
review: Awful app, never works and means you miss out on points. Go with Shell

title: Doesn’t Work
review: The app just won’t work. It fails to load and exits.  Back to the physical card!

title: Useless - use Applepay or Contactless in the shop instead!
review: Selected station and pump number, then £10 fuel option. Petrol filled up then stopped at £9. Couldn’t add any extra to take me to £10 which I’d been charged for. Then went into the shop to query what had happened, they then said I needed to pay for my fuel bill of £9!!! Argh!! What is the point of using an app if it charges you for a fuel value the pump won’t allow you to take and the shop have no visibility of the payment. The shop didn’t even know the app did this!! I’d like my £1 back for the fuel I’ve been charged for, that I wasn’t allowed to fill up to the full value for.

title: Rarely works
review: To begin with it was quite good. The. It stopped working, bank declined the transaction at the garage less than a mile from my home! The garage 55 miles from my home it worked fine! App then stopped working all together then started working again but again bank declined the transaction. In a time (June 2020) when reduced social contact is advised an app that allows contactless payment and fuel fill up would be really useful - if it worked!

title: Deleted.
review:
I installed this app in the clearly mistaken belief that it would allow me to pay for fuel.
Having struggled to even sign up, to have fought against password rules, to have had to deduce which three appa I have to use to make password reset work ... I now have an app
for a rewards programme I have no intention of joining, but apparently not a means of paying for fuel.
Nope.

title: Rewards
review: I have collected points on 3 visits at the start of signing up, But that was it, the next 3 times I have lost over £170 worth of points as they didn’t load onto my card!!
developerResponse: {'id': 16585597, 'body': "Hi there, we are sorry to hear this. If you contact our BPme UK team at BPmeUK@bp.com or on 0800402402 they'll be able to help you further. Many thanks, ^EP", 'modified': '2020-07-13T08:36:53Z'}

title: Completely pointless
review: Over complicated and very very little back in return. Not worth the hassle

title: Simple to use (UK user)
review: Have been using App to keep note of points awards, but chose today to use to pay, you need to read up on the process first but it is vey simple, having linked credit card  (before using) you select petrol station once to arrive (and you can tell App this is your preferred location) and then which pump and after that whether you intend filling up or just a set amount, I chose fill up and as some have criticised it does initially put £100 onto your card as pending transaction, but seems only downside, overall very simple to use and saves time plus concerns you might have (during Covid pandemic) of having to go into shop to pay with card

title: Useless
review:
I always buy fuels for my car from bp for about a year.
I always use bp app for points 
After I got some point worth for  a few pounds ,I start try to use those money from my BPme  app. But it is always decline and I can’t use it, even I can see the amount of my points money on the app. After I tried for 2-3 times. I broke the BP card and threw in to the bin and I will delete this app from my phone after this comment. Why should I keep it for useless app and wasting time to scan when I buy the fuel.
 Not because of a few money , I feel unhappy because I felt I have being cheated.

title: NO Rewards at all
review: BP is absolute rubbish. Overpriced fuel without any benefit. When they have kicked out nectar that was the worst decision ever. BP Reward is a joke it started very well but sorry after few months absolutely nothing you will get nothing with this reward system. BP promised it will be great but is great rubbish. Pay over App another joke is declined all the time and there is nothing wrong with my bank I have checked every time when I have used BP station and BP IT is blaming bank 😂🤣 another good joke. Well useless APP and Reward system is joke!!! Time to move to Esso back to nectar sorry BP but well disappointed with app and specially with your joke reward system. Bey bey 👎

title: The Worst App
review: I cannot get this to work at all.   Every time I try to log in it says “Sorry Something Went Wrong”.   I guess BP doesn’t want my custom - petrol is always a couple of pence more a litre than Esso or Shell anyway.
developerResponse: {'id': 16538557, 'body': "Hi there, sorry you're having trouble with the app. Please drop our team a line at 0800402402 or at bpmeuk@bp.com and they will help you with this. Many thanks and take care ^EP", 'modified': '2020-07-10T15:37:42Z'}

title: Cannot use the app to pay
review: Registration was very easy and off I went to fill up. Registered 3 different cards with 2 different banks but none were useable at the BPme Wantage Petrol Station local to me. Phoned the banks who said there should be no problem. Phoned BPme who are investigating why I can’t use the BPme app. I’m really keen to use the app as I’m Covid Extremely Vulnerable and I’m trying to avoid going in any petrol station shops to pay. Waiting to hear the outcome of bpme’s investigation.

title: Rubbish
review: Put my card details in, selected the petrol station then wouldn’t let me select the pump number or pay. Rubbish. Had to go into the shop which I wanted to avoid.

title: BP garage Clydebank
review: The BP Garage in Clydebank , has the most friendly staff ,they are always willing  to help ,and the forecourt and shop is always clean .
developerResponse: {'id': 16585009, 'body': "Thank you for the lovely feedback! We'll be sure to pass this onto the team on site, many thanks, ^EP", 'modified': '2020-07-13T08:27:18Z'}

title: Complete waste of time
review: Worked well then logged me out and has never been able to log in again. Just says something is wrong. Tried to set up new password which goes through then says something is wrong. After a while I have discovered what is wrong.... me wasting my time with this stupid app, so I deleted it and focused on filling up at shell... something is now right for me at least.

title: £100 pending for every failed attempt.
review: I have used this app twice. The first time worked perfectly with the app recording the payment and an email sent recording the payment. The second time I used it, it all worked right up to the point when I confirmed the payment, when the app announced there had been an error and suggested I try again. This I did with the same result. On checking my credit card account I now see 2 pending transactions of £100 each! Clearly if the app failed it should have deleted the pending amounts.

title: Mr Egwilliams
review: Hi my app keeps logging out.

title: Used to love this App
review: When it worked, filling the petrol tank was a smooth transaction. A smug smile would cross my lips as I slid back into the drivers seat, watching the others traipse to the payment till in the driving rain.  Then my bank’s (Lloyd’s) online security gets upgraded and the app stops working. I the transaction fails and I get a “was this you?” Text from the bank, which tells me to try again 10 minutes later. Now I am a rain sodden, un-smugged punter, who now fills up at the cheapest (none BP) petrol station.

title: Not a bad app but improvements needed
review: App been working fine but last couple of uses it keeps coming up on phone saying contact customer services at the counter as there’s been a problem with the purchase. When I’ve gone into station there’s nothing wrong and still get email confirmation of payment so there’s a glitch in the app some where!

title: Doesn’t work & untrained station staff
review:
Due to pandemic I thought it’d be safer to pay for fuel without going inside shop. Tried it in two stations today and it failed in both stations. 

First station I tried it displayed (no pumps available) although I’m parked next to one. So I called the station and they said they are aware of the fault but they haven’t reported it yet ! 

So I drove of to a second station I googled a few miles away, waited nearly 5mins for the app to unlock the pump and by the time I was done refuelling it displayed an error message saying something went wrong please pay inside the station! So I called the station while parked outside and requested to pay for the fuel by phone because the app failed, I was told I can’t do that and I need to come in to pay! I said if I wanted to come in why would I be using the app ?

In the end, I had to walk in and pay so don’t bother

title: Missing an essential feature
review: The old BP app used to have a feature whereby you could identify BP stations with an M&S food outlet – that was really useful, and it seems it is no longer available. Please restore this as soon as possible!

title: Was good, now useless
review: I’ve been using this app for a couple of years, and it’s been good, but today it refused to recognise the linked card and insisted I had to add a new card, though the existing one has several months to run. But when I tried to add a new one the stupid app refused to recognise it, so after wasting several minutes trying to make it work I then had to join the payment queue and waste several more. Very disappointing. And I used to use BP for Nectar points, but they don’t give them now, so I’m changing to Shell, who do give incentives.

title: Would be an excellent app if it works
review: Unfortunately never works, for the moment I just use to scan the loyalty card and hoping that someone someday will fix this nice app.

title: Very very unreliable
review: I’ve tried to use this app probably 10 times and it’s not worked on half of them. “We are experiencing technical issues please go in and pay” often the issue, also has randomly lost card details. Not worth the hassle at all.

title: Useless
review: Used to work. They updated it and you end up in a loop trying to log in and then it says you’re not near a station. Don’t bother it’s quicker to go in and pay.

title: Very glitchy
review:
Used to work fine. Now never able to use it. Either it thinks I have no payment method stored, or it can’t a station (even if you’re on the forecourt) or it just won’t unlock the pump.
I used to think this app was brilliant, the perfect way to not worry about getting little children out and across busy forecourts. Now it’s an unreliable piece of junk clogging up my phone’s memory.
Please fix it BP.

title: Don’t bother!
review:
As many others have said, this app simply doesn’t work the majority of the time. Every part of the registration process either fails or times-out the first several times you try it, likewise when you attempt to add a payment method.
The Shell and Esso apps work flawlessly, seem much better designed and even support Apple Pay.
May try again in a few months, but until then I’ll be purchasing my petrol from the two companies with functional payment apps.

title: Really buggy and unreliable
review: Takes ages to login, then you randomly get kicked out or told you have no payment cards setup etc.

title: Started out so well..
review: Initially really great app and I thought the obvious way to pay during social distancing but no. App wouldn’t load today then didn’t recognise login. Had to give up and pay in store while I was queuing I got app to open but it could r find the station - I couldn’t collect reward points as app frozen on blank screen by time I reached till. I’ve just spent an hour at home relaunching the app but it continually freezes. Not worth the agro - will look for an alternative.

title: Won’t accept card
review: Tried to use this app but it was woefully slow to locate the petrol station (iPhone 8, strong 4G signal) and then wouldn’t accept my debit card details. Deleted

title: Not working anymore
review: Used to work fine but now constantly asking me to log in and always says there is no petrol station nearby when I am actually at the pump forcing me to pick it from a list. Same problem with my wife’s phone even after reinstalling. Just not worth the effort anymore.

title: Terribly optimised garbage
review:
This app is frustratingly difficult to use. 

It’ll log me out seemingly at random, while I’m using the app. 
It’ll regularly crash and refuse to load the selected page, becoming unresponsive. 
It won’t even let me add my card as a payment method, crashes on the end screen every single time...

Because of these issues I can’t even register my card for BPme rewards, negating the entire point of this app. 
Waste of time.

title: Doesn’t seem to work
review: Have downloaded the app. Had a nightmare trying to login (attempted about 7 times and have up). Tried again a day later and it logged me in automatically but can’t register me for any BP rewards. Then logged me out on my next attempt and is now static standing on a blank white loading page. Really disappointing as I am a regular BP customer.

title: Stephen Halliwell
review:
Quite often the app will say I’m not at a BO station or just won’t start. 
Great idea but needs work

title: Useless app
review: App keeps saying “error try again later” when I try and put payment details on! Went to use at a BP petrol station and despite connecting to their free Wi-fi the app told me I wasn’t connected to the internet! Not great!!

title: So reliably unreliable
review: Has worked properly about once but most of the time either says they can't identify a pump, that I have no registered payment card or the payment card has mysteriously disappeared from the app. A company with annual profits of $10 billion+ should probably do a lot better than this. Especially as the the equivalent Shell app has worked flawlessly. Also why no Apple Pay integration?

title: Appalling app. Slow and unresponsive
review:
Will not recognise fuel stations
When it does there is a significant delay in unlocking pump and authorising payment 
Messages will appear to say there have been payment problems even if payment has gone through
Is not robust enough to rely on
Is not quick enough to be considered as easier than the traditional method of filling up and going inside to pay.

title: USELESS - DON’T WASTE YOUR TIME!
review:
Seems like I’m just another of the countless numbers before me that find this app totally useless and unusable.

Struggled my way through creating an account due to the app glitching. 

Now, even after creating an account for the app, it won’t let me join the BPme rewards scheme despite receiving an email advising that I’ve successfully registered!

App is a total waste of time, so looks like I’ll be driving to my closest SHELL garage to fill up, as their app works really well!

title: Started off well, now crashes and loses data all the time
review: The app was brilliant to begin with and worked well, now is riddled with faults. Logs out all the time, crashes, doesn’t remember your payment methods or can’t find the station you’re sitting in. Hopefully can be fixed

title: Useless
review: App frequently requires fresh login with email and password, which is hardly great when you’re in a kiosk waiting to pay. Why not use fingerprint? Today I was in a BP station and the app said there was no BP location near me. Finally, the garage can’t scan the bar code on the app. Totally useless.

title: This app lost you a loyal customer
review: So every time I use this app it requires me to log in by entering my username an password which is incredibly annoying. Why doesn’t the app remember me or use face recognition??  The last 5 times I’ve used it the app didn’t work, even when connected to the BP free WiFi, so throughout the last few weeks when we’re supposed to be social distancing I’ve had to pay at the till every time I’ve used this app at BP.  I now always fill up at Shell as their app works seamlessly.

title: Not working
review: I thought this would be a great app to get whilst getting fuel with the baby in the car saves us having to get out etc. It never works so end up going into pay like I used to. Asked the worker in there and she said it never seems to work. I will be using another petrol station with a pay at pump facility in the future.

title: Blocked from rewards
review: Using app to get fuel but when I try to join rewards it says my account is blocked and to ring support, support was as much use as a chocolate fire guard!

title: Efficient App
review: Would be nice to see support for pre-setting the £ amount in advance of going to the station and for the BP rewards card to be added to Apple Wallet (as the Shell App does.. ;-))

title: AWFUL!!!
review:
Couldn’t register on line - Blocked me before I even joined! 3 phone calls to Customer Service; “ sorry system down” “best grab a physical card, we have troubles with app” inexperienced non-english as a first language didn’t have a clue. Finally “systems down!”
SHELL was dead easy, this is painful!

title: Don’t bother - constantly declining payment
review: Every single time with the last 2 months (6 times) I’ve tried to pay using this app and it keep getting declined! EVERY TIME! Prior to May 2020 I never had any problems and my bank has confirmed there is no block on my account! It’s so infuriating

title: None operational
review:
The App has not work in several months, the fuel stations managers recognise this too
This should be deleted from the App Store

title: Rarely works
review: I’d say 50% of the time this app doesn’t connect. The lady serving at the BP near me said much the same thing when I had to go inside to pay. Now there’s an update that doesn’t update! I am assuming BP have asked their staff to review the app hence the higher than average reviews.

title: Brilliant BP
review: Fantastic APP. Helps safety as well

title: Avoid if you want to fill outup quickly
review: I can't understand why this app gets such good reviews, 4 times I have tried to use this at a station, pre loaded the app with userid and password with payment details, it either doesnt remember my login or when it does forget my payment details, operationally flawed adding them then takes an eternity to login by which time you have a queue behind you of screaming bad tempered customers. Also it's too slow, so by encouraging the use it is lowering the operational throughout of the station through delaying the throughput.

title: Don’t bother. Doesn’t work
review: Just downloaded the app after receiving an email from BP telling me to do so. However, every time I log in it asks me to accept the privacy and t&c’s updates (which I do), it takes me to the homepage and then instantly back to the page that asks me to accept the updates. It’s a loop that means I can’t actually use the app.

title: Stopped working
review: Can’t currently open the app. When I open it on my iPhone  I am directed in the opening screen to download an update (with no option not to/proceed to the app). Then I’m taken to the AppStore, where there is no update available. So what you have here is an opening screen and an inescapable Koop of bugs. Sort it out eh?

title: A good idea, but...
review: ...could be better! The first time I tried to use it, the app froze. The second time, I realised it didn’t support Apple Pay and I didn’t have my physical card on me. Both times I had to go in to pay for my fuel which is exactly what I was trying to avoid! The freezing issue seems to have been fixed with an update and I have registered my card now but support for Apple Pay would be a welcome addition!

title: Best service - especially during COVID!
review: I now never go to another petrol station now. I love that it’s all contact less and risk free!

title: Dreadful App
review:
This is easily the worst app that I have ever used. 
Concept is great but terrible in practice. 
I have lost track of how many times my bank have frozen my account thinking the app was fraudulent. 
Bank blames BP, BP blames the bank. 
The BP in store staff simply shrug their shoulders and claim they don’t have a clue.
So frustrating. 
Problems only began when the app was updated whenever it switched from Nectar points to BPMe points. 
Final straw is that I now can’t even add any card to my account.

title: Disappointing.
review:
Every time I need to just drive up to a station and refuel - this useless App either has logged out, lost my payment card or throws the error “something is wrong, please pay in store”!

Supposed to be convenient right? Well all the other people paying the normal way have paid and long gone while I’m constantly sitting here like a muppet trying to get this useless app to work!!!

title: Pretty straight forward
review: Good thing BPme has been introduced. Means we can pay for fuel without needing to go inside the shop. Helpful in slowing the virus in the current pandemic

title: Convenient
review: Very convenient, saves time sometimes though, the app loses your card details and you have to start all over again, but not too often, great app I love it,more stations need to be involved.

title: Safe and quick
review: A great app which not only saves me time but is COVID friendly.

title: Brilliant app
review: Used yesterday for the first as filled up before lock down and have only just needed more fuel. Thought I'd give this app a go so didn't have to go near anyone and it worked flawlessly. Will definitely use again.

title: Never works when needed!
review: Decided to switch to BP as all my local Shell garages have shut (almost) and have a BP one 100yrds from my place of work but the app has only worked 3 times out of 7 or 8 fill ups! Twice it required an update (that wouldn’t work until my phone was home and on WiFi ( even though I have 10gig left) and the other times the card would not open only allowing “pay at pump” and location services. So out of a possible £500 of fuel bought I’ve only got points for around £150! Very frustrating

title: Suzanne
review:
Great idea but app doesn’t work.

Sat in car trying to get it to work and didn’t want to go into garage as shielding.

Told to try in 10 mins, still didn’t work.

Managed to use it once - brilliant idea shame no longer operational

title: Poor
review: When it works it’s great, sadly the last few months it works on rare occasions, hasn’t worked for me for over a week now, deleted it, reinstalled it, rebooted the phone still getting the “we are having technical issues”

title: Terrible Set Up Might Never Use
review:
By the time I’d finished the long winded set up including some multiple emailed verification codes the app blocked my, nil balance, rewards account (to protect me apparently). It did not seem to like that I didn’t already have a loyalty card. Only plus side was it made me try The Shell App which was easy to install and that uses Apple Pay.

Have now called BP to sort out the blocked account. Spoke to someone who said I needed the ‘specialist App team’ but having waited ages on hold for them they have just cut me off before getting round to answering. Might be able to use the pay service without the rewards ever being unblocked but unless I have no other choice I’ll be using a competitor.

title: Customer service
review:
My personal option waiting two months for a query transaction on my card which is temporarily blocked due to fraud ??? ( garage took point assumably in error ) 
This has pointed
Me in the direction of another loyalty scheme at different garage least I actually
Get my club card points for my loyalty

title: Good
review: I like this app. Any chance of a CarPlay App to go with it?

title: Please read before using!
review: In the days of covid, I decided that paying for fuel via an app would be beneficial. Registered all my details... pump registered... select amount (fortunately I had the sense to adjust ‘full tank’ to £50!!!)... payment authorised... then ‘sorry, something went wrong, please try again’ so I do try again. Same message. At this point, I decided it wasn’t worth the trouble so fortunately didn’t try again. I fill up and go into the filling station and pay. Three days later and 2 x £50 has been taken from my bank account plus the amount I paid in the station. I’ve contacted BP and received no reply so having to go through the banks to claim the money back. Please don’t use this app - it really shouldn’t be allowed on the market.

title: Didn’t work when I needed it
review: Downloaded and registered to ensure contactless filling, but once I arrived at the station (Silvertown) it had “technical issues” and wouldn’t work, so ended up having to go into the shop anyway. Would have used a different brand station if I’d known that the app didn’t work.

title: Good when it works
review: Exceptionally unreliable. My last four attempts at using (at three different locations) have resulted in funds being blocked on my card but the transaction cancelling.

title: Unreliable app
review:
This app is seriously not reliable. The majority of times I’ve tried to use it have been unsuccessful. It either doesn’t recognise my payment card details, can’t locate BP forecourts or it simply hangs or freezes. 
DO NOT rely on this as a sole means of paying for fuel...you could be stranded. That’s actually dangerous!

title: Add camera option
review: Add to manually upload points via phone camera, using till receipt bar code. Had a few occasions when my points have not been added whilst paying in store.

title: Can’t put the BP card in my Apple wallet
review: Got the app so I could get the BP card in my Apple wallet but the app isn’t coming up as supported in my wallet. Absolutely no point in keeping the app for me, may as well just photo the card instead

title: No locator
review: Dreadful App.   BP SHOULD BE ASHAMED

title: Doesnt work with TSB
review: Very hit and miss with my TSB bank account works very occasionally but have now given up

title: Won’t let me log in
review: Using iOS the app won’t let me log in to use my car at the till when paying for fuel, my partner uses my card and I use the app, if I log in using Safari it works fine but app won’t work

title: Completely pointless
review: I have had this app for a while, I have yet to use it successfully despite trying at every BP station I have visited, it always says “ we are experiencing technical issues pay in shop” I have an iPhone 11, in these times I would rather pay from my car but this app is pointless.

title: works sometimes
review: just fuelled using the app, ended going in the store to confirm payment

title: Rubbish
review: Am sick of driving specially to a bp garage for fuel only to find this won’t work/ having technical issues.  Pathetic BP - can do better !
developerResponse: {'id': 16585132, 'body': "Hi Charlie, we are sorry you are having trouble logging into our app. If you contact our BPme UK Customer Service team at BPmeUK@bp.com they'll be able to help you further. Many thanks, ^EP", 'modified': '2020-07-13T08:29:32Z'}

title: Useless unless either full signal or opened before entering station
review: Anything other than full strength signal and the app won’t load any data, including your barcode which means you’re either having to leave the building to try and get signal or just accepting that you won’t be able to scan the card. Having the option to add the barcode to wallet would be a massive help and benefit.

title: VERY FAULTY
review: I’m trying to make a payment via the app yet it doesn’t allow me to do so. This has been happening for a while now. Please sort this out ASAP. Thank you

title: Dodgy App
review: Does not always work, Esso App much better!

title: Apple Pay?
review: The year is 2020, Apple Pay integration should be there out of the gate!  What a pointless app!  Shell know what they are doing BP not so!
developerResponse: {'id': 5973384, 'body': "We're working to add more ways to pay, so will hopefully offer more options in the future. Thanks ^AW", 'modified': '2018-11-16T10:49:25Z'}

title: Apple Wallet Support
review: With this latest update, you seem determined to keep the loyalty card ‘in app’ rather than where it would be most convenient, in Apple Wallet. Even Shell do that now; why don’t you join them?

title: Allow reward card to show in Apple Wallet!
review: Poor signal in some areas means the app won’t load up or sign-in in time for when you’re at the till. If the rewards card was available in Apple wallet then this would solve the issue of not needing to even open it. Other fuel stations have done it....so you need to too. Thanks.

title: No Support
review: For 3 weeks I’ve been contacting support as I’m unable to add a payment card to my app/account. The major feature of this app is to pay at pump and it simply doesn’t work for me and no one in support at BP seems to want to help.

title: Declined again!
review:
You’d think at this present state of affairs that BP would have this app sorted by now. 
Constant declined transactions have forced me to go into a shop enclosed space which I do not want to enter At
Present. 
Using a different company from now on Esso have an app that actually works!

Update: 10/9/20
No update as nothing’s changed. Totally useless and unhelpful. Had customer services look at my issue twice and don’t seem to have any idea or clue of why. 
Brand leader in fuel. 
Last in app technology.
developerResponse: {'id': 16585700, 'body': "Hi Brian, sorry you're having trouble with the app. Please drop our team a line at 0800402402 or at bpmeuk@bp.com and they will help you with this. Many thanks, ^EP", 'modified': '2020-07-13T08:38:20Z'}

title: Endless hold loop
review: This app seems to send me to an endless hold loop of accepting terms and conditions.

title: Doesn’t work
review: Downloaded this app as it sounded good, pulled up at my local BP station and all it says is that I’m not near a BP station!!! So I deleted it and reinstalled it and stood next to the Petrol pump and you guessed it it said I wasn’t near a BP station???? It doesn’t help to keep people safe and not have to go into the shop to pay, it does the opposite and you have to go in as the only reason you’re there is because you need to fill up!!! VERY frustrating!!!

title: Great app
review: App is great. Works perfectly. As a result, I haven’t needed to mask up and go inside to pay for fuel since COVID started.

title: Stuck in a loop trying to reset password
review: When trying to reset password I have been stuck in a loop- when you send me the auth code to my email after password reset I cannot get back to the screen to enter the code. Tried three times, can’t do it, deleting app now.

title: Never actually works
review: This worked once, when I installed it. Ever since then it is unable to either locate the station or the pump number. Total waste of time.

title: Siiiick
review: so easy

title: Great, easy to use
review: I have digitalised my loyalty cards recently which required me to download a lots of apps. Comparing this to the others, it was straight forward, everything has worked at first, It is easy to use, fuel card can be attached too and also loyalty cards can be added easily.

title: Doesn’t work!
review: Every time I try to use this app it tells me it has “technical issues” and I have to go into the shop to pay which given the COVID situation is something I try to avoid. Struggle to see the point in the app if it doesn’t work.

title: Don’t waste your time
review: App didn’t not work and also caused my bank card to be blocked for suspicious activity when trying to use this app

title: No internet no access to reward card
review: Unfortunately this app is useless without internet connection. I forgot my physical reward card which I wanted to scan for points so I wanted to try this digital version in the app but because was very bad mobile connection I couldn't get access to it and only wasted my time and also I upset people waiting in the queue behind me...

title: No Apple Pay?
review:
The functionality of the app has improved greatly (when I first started using it, more often than not it didn’t work at the pump and I ended up having to go into the station to pay.... defeating the object) but still no Apple Pay option, and still the insistence on placing a reserve of £100 on my card if I want to fill the tank? All your competitors’ apps (Shell, Esso, etc.) don’t do this; they charge for exactly the amount pumped, and they offer Apple Pay as a payment option.
Please get with the programme, BP.

title: Not working
review: The app has been great but it seems to have stopped working when you try and select pump number????

title: Pile of crap
review: We are in a pandemic the app always has technical issues so I have to queue up and pay.

title: Ease of use.
review: Very straightforward to use and in these troubled times means one less contact I have to make. Well done BP for an App that does exactly what it says. Thanks.

title: Urgent - REFUSES TO UPDATE EXPIRING CARD
review:
Have tried many times to update my card which expires at the end of the month with its replacement. I’ve tried at home on Wi-Fi and on mobile broadband. It always says there’s an error and will not update. 

Please fix this before the end of October.
developerResponse: {'id': 8752966, 'body': "Hi there. We're ending our Nectar partnership on the 31st May, so that may be why. Don't worry though, we've got an exciting new reward scheme coming that we think you'll really like, so keep an eye out. Thanks ^AW", 'modified': '2019-05-20T09:22:55Z'}

title: BPme
review: Excellent idea, very useful. But... always has glitches, still have to go in store to make payment as app keeps having ‘technical problems’

title: A real pain
review: I need to change my e-mail address. But it seams you can’t change it. Even if you move house for instance and change internet accounts. So I have to start a new card. Very convenient with everything else I have to change or sort out.

title: Total pain to use
review: You can’t just pump your fuel and then pay with the app. You have to pre-register, then use the app to ‘unlock’ the pump before you pump the fuel. Total user unfriendly rubbish.

title: Excellent staff
review: Always use same bp staff are absolutely brilliant helpful cheerful hard working always have a smile and chat. Had great selection although wished they’d re introduce garlic coriander prawns 🤗 well done BP sixfrields Northampton

title: Doesn't work
review: Tried to use at the BP in Lenham, Kent to avoid getting stuck behind lots of people doing their weekly shop and it just doesn't work. BP are not the only oil company who just can't seem to get the pay apps right. Just fit a card reader on the pump!

title: Cannot add to Wallet
review: No option to add card to the Apple Wallet App

title: Clogs up available funds on bank account
review: When the system works it is really handy but in the past week it didn’t work properly. It asked me to retry which I did three times. I now have £400 of pending transactions since last Friday (now Tuesday) and it hasn’t cleared from my account. It is deducted from available balance which is a complete pain

title: Ignores iOS settings, no Apple Pay support
review:
No Apple Pay support, unlike competitors. 

Has a built-in app feedback system that ignores iOS’s “do not pester me about reviews” setting and interrupted me with an annoying popup message. That’s an instant 1-star review as far as I’m concerned. I’m surprised the App Store allows it.

title: App doesn’t work
review:
Used this app successfully for months, then one day it stopped working, just when it’s really needed with COVID-19. 
I reported it to BPme who replied to say the problem was fixed. It wasn’t!
Perhaps it’s the local service station that’s disabled the function, or BP doesn’t pay it’s stations in a timely manner... however the app doesn’t work for me at my local BP. 
 BPme App 1-9783148828

title: Unreliable
review: It’s completely hit or miss if it works or not. I use it to keep track of work travel expenses but twice this week alone I haven’t been able to use it to pay.

title: Avoid, if you don’t like double charges in your card
review: Nice concept when it works. Second time I get double charged. One from the company that operates the app and one from the BP station.

title: Just awful
review: Why does everyone want their own app when could just use a simple well established payment method? This app is long winded to set up and doesn't warn you that you need to set it up in advanced of pumping the petrol. Frustrating and aggravating to the point I may never visit a BP again. Seriously, do better.

title: Divyesh
review: Excellent app and easy to use. No more in queue for paying fuel

title: Great App
review: Super

title: Poor
review: No response from customer support, no answer to phone and no reply to message query ...... will delete app I think

title: Useful when you want to leave your cards at home
review: This app has improved since the last incarnation. I’d love to be able to add my rewards card to the Apple Wallet which I can’t seem to do

title: Absolutely hopeless
review: My local petrol station is BP so I would be mad not to collect points. However the app is hopeless. I get emails of offers and go to log in and it doesn’t ever recognise my password. So I go through all the reset and it says we have sent a code. Well nothing ever turns up so I have to ask in the shop what’s on the card. Aggghhhh but BP’s IT departments have always been rubbish from my experience.

title: Brilliant - as long as it’s working
review: To be fair, the app does seem to be getting more stable/reliable with each passing month but the odd day when it won’t work can be really annoying (only two months ago I would have only given three stars, so on this trajectory it could be heading for five). On days that it works it is fantastic - quick, easy, efficient.

title: Passcode / Pin
review: Please, implement a passcode / pin for app entry!

title: Not getting the reward points
review: Not getting my reward points showing after each time I scan the reward card

title: Very impressed!
review: What a nice slick and trendy service! Love the app! Well done BP👍

title: Excellent
review: A great service very helpful and easy to use.

title: Stick with Esso or Shell
review: Twice missed the points as cashier decided not to swap it and there’s no way to tell if you got the points or not straight away. And hardly any customer service these days impossible to contact anyone

title: please add car wash to the app
review: Would be nice if you could  pay and get a number for the car wash and hovers at sites so don’t need to go in to the shop.

title: *WARNING*
review: If you are filling up in an area where two service stations are in the same proximity you can be charged at the wrong location,  and be asked to pay manually at the correct outlet.

title: Can’t add my card to Apple wallet
review: Unlike other reward scheme apps I am unable to store my card details in Apple wallet

title: Good but needs Apple Wallet
review: Please add functionality to add the BP Me rewards card to Apple Wallet!

title: Amazing app!
review: Already loves for the pay for fuel feature, but it’s going from strength to strength with the recent design changes and new features! Keep up the good work!

title: Useless app - fails a lot
review: Don’t bother with this App. Stations advertise it and aren’t actually set up to use it: the App fails regularly. Ranging from failing to unlock pumps to deleting payment details, to not using Location Services correctly. A solution to Covid-19 so you don’t have to go into the store to pay? Rubbish!!! Had to go into one twice today because this useless App doesn’t do what it is supposed to do. Go and buy your petrol from Shell or anyone else other than BP. A joke considering the size of company and money they make. What’s worse is BP’s prices are higher than anyone else - wouldn’t mind if the app and purported convenience actually worked and was delivered on. Rubbish. Rubbish. Rubbish. Guess we shouldn’t be surprised from a company that poured oil all over the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Utterly Useless!
review: Doesn’t work with my Lloyds card. Every time I’ve tried to use this it declines my payment and raises a fraud alert with my bank. I have tried 5 times and have had to sit on the phone for ages trying to unlock my card - 5 times. The bank say it’s not them, it’s  the app. This is the only transaction that has ever raised any issues with the bank so I’m inclined to believe the bank. I thought this would be great in these COVID times but honestly, there is no point in having it. It just doesn’t work.

title: Needs Apple Pay option
review: The app is handy to have especially when wanting  to save time but if the app had Apple Pay has a option it would be much easier and when trying to select the amount of fuel you want to pay for the bank then intervenes and stops the payment

title: Great App
review:
Really like the app and it’s concept in giving back something to loyal customers.

Suggestion: have a tab for recent transactions so you can see how many points you’ve earned each time & be able to redeem points/cash value via the app.

title: past purchases still not foxed
review:
their has been 5 updates and yet the past purchases section still does not display the dates when you have purchased petrol?? 

terrible!!

title: Non functional
review: I cannot use the app sadly as the app immediately closes every time I attempt to add a payment method. I'm running the latest iOS 14 on an iPhone SE 2020. Please fix asap

title: Unusable
review:
How many times do I have to accept the terms? Is 20 times enough?

No. 

It loops and loops and I won’t be using BP stations until this is fixed. 

Testing. Testing. Testing.

title: Great (when it works)
review: Used it 6 times. Worked brilliantly 3 times saving me having to touch anything other than the pump. The other times you end up in the shop handing your phone over to the cashier to collect your points. Hardly the COVID experience I was aiming for. Now I’m just stuck in an useless “Accept New Licence Agreement” loop unable to do anything.

title: Repeat Repeat
review: Accept new terms and privacy. Tick and tick. Accept new terms and privacy. Tick and tick. Accept new terms and privacy. Tick and tick. Come on get it sorted. Cheers 👍

title: Cannot log in
review: After update it keeps asking to confirm terms and conditions on and on and it’ll not let me login

title: Useless
review: Stuck on accept new terms and conditions screen after last update. Maybe you should get yourself some QAs

title: Loved the app now useless!
review: Been using the app with absolutely no issues. Brilliant during the pandemic, but now the t&cs have changed and the app needs an update it won’t update after I accept the changes, so got stuck and had no choice but to go in and pay, defeating the object of trying to avoid people

title: Unusable on my iPad
review:
This is unusable on my iPad, or iPhone. I logged in. It told me I needed to accept the terms and conditions, not once, not three times, not five times, but 20 times. I uninstalled and reinstalled the app.

I then went through their I’d verification app a second time (hard to credit, as I’d just signed in on this device), and am up to my 35th attempt to accept the terms and conditions (i.e. 50+ times total) and I’m still unable to get in.

Thinking it might be an issue with my iPad, I tried it again with my iPhone. Guess what. The exact same issue. I’m up to 100 failed logins across 2 devices. This is the definition of unusable.

Classy, BP, classy.

title: Broken !!
review: Loved the app... but today it’s broke... on login it now requires me to accept new t&c and privacy statements.. when I check the boxes  and hit accept.. it refreshes the screen and goes back to the same page again ig Irving my acceptance ... constant circle !  Cannot use BP petrol until fixed ...please advise ASAP

title: Great app
review: Easy to set up and use at the pump. I don’t always want to go in the shop so it’s great for keeping your distance in these difficult times.

title: Useful rewards
review: The new BP reward scheme is effective, clear and valuable. So much better than many other reward schemes

title: Shocking
review: Won’t open, won’t refresh, won’t update, won’t except my password...

title: Useless !
review: Tried to use this app 3 times, never worked and each time had to contact my bank to get them to unfreeze my card.

title: What has happened?
review: Used this app for ages to pay for fuel, then last couple of months it’s unusable. Despite never logging out, would get to the station forecourt and get asked to log in - wouldn’t let me, just got a blank screen. This happened multiple times. Then tried to log in at home before attempting again and after an update I ticked the permission boxes multiple times and could not go any further forward! It’s so frustrating as it used to work perfectly fine. Please sort it out!

title: Great
review: Easy to navigate round and easy to work, only thing is that it could be compatible for apple wallet so the rewards card is there already rather than always having to go into the app every time to get it up.

title: Apple Wallet Integration Missing
review: Please link the rewards card to Apple Wallet. The days of carrying a card are over. Digging into the app is nowhere near as convenient.

title: Infuriating - please wait while we unlock your pump
review:
When this works, it’s great......but at least 50% of the time, it leaves you sitting in the car while you look at the ‘please wait, we’re unlocking your pump’ message. Followed by the, ‘sorry this is taking longer than usual’. 

So you then close the app and try again, but are faced with the same problem. Now, you’ve wasted what feels like 5 minutes waiting for the pump to be unlocked in a busy petrol station. 

In current covid times, the ability to pay from the app is more important than ever. Coupled with having 2 young kids and not wanting to take them out of the car on a miserable winter evening to go in and pay, this app is infuriating when it doesn’t work. 

I’ve driven off without fuelling up on multiple occasions now feeling frustrated at the poor user experience this app delivers.

title: Nice app but
review: Every time I try to add my card details the app crashes, so even if I wanted to use the app at a station I can’t.

title: Great
review: Makes it so much easier to fill the car up with no need to queue to pay. Great facility and especially if have children in the car ....

title: Didn’t work at all
review: Failed to unlock pump

title: No
review: Staff are great & helpful

title: COVID refuelling
review: Excellent, non contact quality refuelling except for gloved hand really good idea during Covid times.

title: Payment cards declined
review:
I have 2 cards registered and both were declined yesterday and again today - WHY? I’m not impressed with the app at all!

Martin Croly

title: Poor
review: Installed app logged in then changed password logged out then would let me login again saying something like cookies had to be enabled strange thing for a app to say so not impressed

title: Fab
review: Love this app. Makes it so easy to pay for fuel and means i don’t have to go into the shop. it’s easy to use but of course is dependant on mobile phone signal but thus far that hasn’t been an issue.

title: Made filling up the car so much easier and safer!
review: Love the app, especially now that it works on all the BP’s around me! I can easily pay through the app so I don’t have to go inside the shop, wait in line or nothing! Just brilliant!

title: Keeps looping round to set a password
review: I’ve been trying to set up the app for sometime. The app keeps telling me to set a password on email - but this keeps looping - it’s infuriating! Not a great experience at all

title: Great
review: Amazing

title: Best app and good fuel ⛽️
review: Fantastic, I love 💕💕BP points bonus system.... ... saving money 💵...

title: Better then ESSO
review: Much better than the Esso App that keeps logging me out every time I’m sat at the filling station I have to mess around with reset password. Now I just use BP only..

title: Very good!
review: The reward system for BP is very good and used the points against my Christmas shop in M&S and it saved us a fortune. Very pleased.

title: Excellent
review: Most things you need in BP garages

title: Mrs miler
review: I lik

title: Works half the time....
review: You couldn’t rely on the app to pay for fuel, half the time it fails to work.

title: Very Convenient

title: No Apple Pay Option?
review: Fairly standard fuel app, works fine and easy to set up, except unlike the Shell app, this one doesn’t give the Apple Pay option.

review:
This is the Best and easiest way to pay and collect your Bp me points 
Which you can use to pay for food,
This is Not Just Food, this is 
“M&S yummy food, snack for you and families 
Wow 😲
Bp me App , M&S Food 
Awesome 😎

title: Don’t use - support does not exist
review:
When it works it’s ok. The support team at BP are non existent. I have messaged numerous times, called left messages - nothing.

App will not take credit card, can’t change email address via the app.

Reasonable app let down by BP.
